author: Admin
title: Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu Offers Free Consultations for Immigration and Family Law Services
text:
Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu offers FREE consultations for Immigration & Family Law. Expert guidance for a brighter future!
The Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu, a distinguished legal practice based in New York, is excited to announce its commitment to providing free consultations for individuals seeking assistance in immigration and family law matters. With a focus on helping those in need, Attorney Ghenadie Rusu is extending this offer to support individuals looking for guidance on Adjustment of Status (Green Card) and Special Immigrant Juvenile Status cases.
Immigrating to the USA can be a complex process, and the Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu understands the importance of reliable legal representation. Whether individuals are navigating the path to Green Card status or require assistance with Special Immigrant Juvenile Status, Attorney Ghenadie Rusu is here to offer expert legal counsel.
“Empowering individuals with the right legal support is crucial, especially in immigration and family law matters. We are pleased to provide free consultations to those in need, ensuring they have the information and guidance necessary to make informed decisions,” said Attorney Ghenadie Rusu.
The Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu specializes in a range of legal services, including immigration law and family law. Attorney Ghenadie Rusu brings a wealth of experience and expertise to help clients achieve their legal goals.
Individuals seeking legal assistance in Adjustment of Status (Green Card) or Special Immigrant Juvenile Status cases can take advantage of the free consultation offered by the Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu. This initiative reflects the firm’s commitment to making legal services accessible to those who need them.
For more information about the Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu and the free consultation offer, visit their
website.
About Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu:
The Law Office of Ghenadie Rusu is a trusted legal practice based in New York, specializing in immigration law and family law. Attorney Ghenadie Rusu is dedicated to providing expert legal counsel and support to individuals facing immigration challenges and family law matters.
For Media Inquiries about their services, visit their
website.

author: SoyChile
title: Para celebrar los 149 años de Viña del Mar: escuadrilla acrobática de la FACh realizará hoy espectáculo en el borde costero
text: Este jueves, Viña del Mar cumple 149 años desde su fundación, por ello se realizará la presentación de la escuadrilla acrobática de la Fuerza Aérea de Chile (FACH), “Los Halcones”, a las 18:00 horas, frente a la playa Los Cañones (recta Las Salinas). En la oportunidad también se presentará la banda de la Academia Politécnica Naval.“Vamos a celebrar los 149 años de la ciudad con un gran espectáculo de los Halcones de la Fach, en el borde costero de nuestra comuna. Un momento para reunirnos, disfrutar del evento que además tendrá música, en un ambiente familiar tranquilo y seguro. Hemos preparado diversos panoramas para conmemorar un año más de nuestra fundación como ciudad, en el recién recuperado Teatro Municipal, en la Playa de Los Cañones y esperamos que la comunidad se pueda sumar. Todos estos hitos serán gratuitos y abiertos para todos los viñamarinos y quienes nos visiten”, señaló la alcaldesa Macarena Ripamonti.Además, sumándose a esta efeméride, se realizará el concierto de aniversario en el Teatro Municipal de Viña del Mar con la presentación de “Cantoras”, a las 19:00 horas, espectáculo que estará enfocado a la música de grandes creadoras y mujeres chilenas.El evento estará a cargo de la Orquesta Andina PUCV, acompañada de las cantantes Magdalena Matthey, Thaís Olivera y Mora Lucay.

author: @elperiodic
title: Xàtiva instal·la dues vàlvules reductores de pressió a la xarxa d’aigua potable amb una inversió de 9.000 euros
text:
Xàtiva instal·la dues vàlvules reductores de pressió a la xarxa d’aigua potable amb una inversió de 9.000 euros
Aquesta actuació, realitzada al Carraixet i al sector Palanques, permetrà evitar fuites d’aigua i costoses reparacions
L’Ajuntament de Xàtiva ha procedit a la substitució de dues vàlvules reductores de pressió de la xarxa d’aigua potable amb una inversió de vora 9.000 euros.
La necessitat de la instal·lació d’una reductora de pressió radica en què la xarxa d’aigua potable pateix un excés de pressió en les zones més baixes, la qual cosa provoca fuites d’aigua i costoses reparacions. Aquesta actuació permet regular la pressió al nivell suportable per la xarxa evitant aquesta problemàtica.
Les reductores de pressió s’han instal·lat en la zona de les Palanques i en el Carraixet, per tal d’estabilitzar la pressió. Es tracta d’un sistema complex que ha de tindre una alimentació permanent de la xarxa, per a poder regular-se adequadament i arribe a totes les persones usuàries.
«L’Ajuntament de Xàtiva continua amb les obres de millora a la xarxa de distribució d’aigua potable i en els darrers dies s’ha completat la instal·lació d’aquestes reguladores de pressió que protegiran la xarxa en la zona de les Palanques i del Carraixet», ha explicat el regidor d’Aigües Potables Ignacio Reig, qui ha remarcat que «anem a tancar 2024 en una inversió superior a 600.000 euros destinada a aigües potables, i de cara al proper any ja hi ha dotades partides molt considerables. La xarxa pública d’aigua potable de la nostra ciutat és absolutament prioritària i per això anem a seguir invertint per millorar-la».

author: Nicolás Sturtz
title: “El nenito lleva dos días sin comer”: los estremecedores audios que complican a Carlos Pérez en el caso Loan | Radio Mitre
text: Ya pasaron 55 días de la desaparición de [Loan Danilo Peña](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/policiales/preparemonos-para-muy-malas-noticias-conmocion-por-el-grave-anuncio-de-rolando-barbano-sobre-que-paso-con-loan/) y la Justicia sigue juntando pistas en el caso. En medio de la investigación se dieron a conocer unos nuevos audios que podrían complicar la situación procesal de [Carlos Pérez](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/policiales/caso-loan-eliminaron-mensajes-del-celular-de-carlos-perez-mientras-estaba-en-poder-de-la-policia/), la pareja de Victoria Caillava. Se filtró una comprometedora foto borrada del celular de Carlos Pérez que podría dar un oscuro giro en el caso Loan Los estremecedores audios que complican a Carlos Pérez en el caso Loan Sobre los audios, Paula Bernini explicó que eran del 15 de junio y Carlos Pérez mencionaba: “El nenito por ahí se vino porque el papá había quedado con nosotros conversando. Y se quiso venir con su papá y los otros chicos, capaz que no estaban controlados por los tres adultos que estaban ahí”. Luego, la misma voz en el audio dijo: “El nenito, bueno, no llegó nunca, se perdió” y agregó: “En ese ratito ya enseguida lo empezaron a buscar, algo como una travesura, un chico que se pierde, ¿viste? Pero lo que pasa es que era una zona complicada, ¿eh? Y bueno, todavía no lo encuentran”. “Loan murió”, conmoción por la trágica confesión de un testigo de la desaparición del nene que confirmaría la peor teoría Encuentran zapatilla en una laguna mientras avanzan en la investigación por la búsqueda de Loan Con respecto a cómo avanzaba la policía en la causa, el audio de Carlos Pérez decía: “Encontraron una zapatilla, supuestamente de él, en una laguna, en el barro pegada en una laguna”. “Algunas huellas que suponen que es del nenito, pero como que no tienen continuidad, ¿viste? Como que por ahí pareciera como que camina o alguien lo alza”, comentó. “Se las vamos a devolver”, la catastrófica revelación de los papás de Loan tras la desaparición del nene que destapó un horroroso secreto familiar Se complica el caso por la desaparición de Loan: eliminaron mensajes del celular de Carlos Pérez mientras estaba en poder de la policía Surgió una nueva polémica alrededor de la Policía de Corrientes por el caso Loan después de que la Justicia detecte mensajes eliminados en el celular de Carlos Pérez cuando este ya estaba en manos de esta fuerza. Se inició una investigación judicial después de que se compruebe que hubo chats borrados en el dispositivo después de que Pérez quedara detenido. Gustavo Briend, abogado de la familia del menor, confirmó la noticia y se esperan medidas del Juzgado Federal de Goya.

author: Jacob Willeford
title: Four items to help improve your sleep for less than $170 and there’s a comforter perfect for ‘hot sleepers’
text:
THERE are at least four crucial items that can help American consumers sleep their best as winter approaches.
Each is relatively easy on the budget , staying under $140 for those who want to scoop them all up and improve their nighttime routines.
5 There are several products that could drastically help your sleep this month (stock image) Credit: GETTY 5 The Evercool Cooling Comforter from Rest is a top choice for many consumers Credit: Rest While the weather is getting cooler nationwide, some still live in warmer climates, and others naturally run hot during sleep .
Turning the thermostat to between 66 and 72 degrees Fahrenheit can help, but there's also the Evercool Cooling Comforter from Rest to help save on energy bills .
The Evercool Cooling Comforter offers a "temperature-regulating technology" known as OEKO-TEX in the fabric that also wicks away moisture effortlessly, per the product description .
It offers a cool and dry sensation that's also hypoallergenic and pet-friendly.
Read More on Sleep
SWEET DREAMS 6 tips to get a good night's sleep this winter ahead of clocks going back
TICKED OFF Daylight Saving Time disrupts sleep for weeks - date Americans start to dread it The comforter is also machine washable and reversible, coming in sizes for Twin/Twin XL, Full/Queen, and King/Cali King beds.
Those who have a Twin/Twin XL can get the comforter on sale right now for $139, down from $199.
Customers can also get six color options, including Aqua Blue, Cool Gray, Lavender Breeze, Snow Ivory, Arctic White, and Midnight Blue.
The Evercool Cooling Comforter from Rest is award-winning and has over 5,000 reviews with an overall 4.8 out of five-star rating.
Most read in Money
SOFA SHUTDOWN Popular furniture chain announces huge sale as it shuts every store in US
CUP CRAZE Starbucks confirms exact date of Red Cup Day after weeks of customer speculation
SETTLE UP Americans have days to claim $100 direct payment in $5.6m data breach settlement
SOCIAL SAGA 'Extraordinary' money you will save if Trump makes change to Social Security SLEEP CLOCK If you're looking for a comprehensive adjustment to improve your sleep and even how you wake up in the morning, the Restore 2 smart alarm clock from Hatch could also be a smart purchase.
The Restore 2 isn't just a standard alarm clock — it comes with several features, including sleep sounds to play and help you fall asleep, a bedside light, dimmable digits, and a sunrise alarm with natural light that gradually brightens.
Primark launches huge range of Christmas gifts for under £5 - including dupe of Dior's £33 lip oil & luxe sleep eye mask There are also "rest" and rise" buttons to help start a phone and blue light-free bedtime and wakeup.
The Restore 2 is only 7.24 inches in length, 2.43 inches in width, and 5.31 inches in height, with a weight of 1.27 pounds, making it perfect for nightstands.
It also has a one-year warranty and comes in three colors — Putty, Latte, and Slate.
Over 2,000 reviewers rated it four out of five stars or above, and the listing price is currently $169.99.
BUY IT NOW Rest Evercool Cooling Comforter: $139.99 - buy here Hatch Restore 2 Sleep Clock: $169.99 - buy here Lunya Washable Silk Sleep Mask: $50 - buy here Loop Dream Earplugs: $49.95 - buy here Consumers who have trouble with overactive senses during sleep might also benefit from two other essentials — the Washable Silk Sleep Mask from Lunya and the Loop Dream Earplugs.
SILK MASK Lunya's Washable Silk Sleep Mask is made of 100% Mulberry Silk on the exterior and is thermoregulating, meaning it won't get too hot over the eyes while sleeping.
It also helps reduce noise and comes with a small bag for safe keeping and to help it remain sanitary before bedtime.
It comes in four standard colors and three limited edition colors, including Immersed Black, Deep Blue, Meditative Gray, Delicate Pink, Hushed Tan, Waterlily Small, and Carmine Red.
Customers can get it for just $50 in a final sale on Lunya's website.
EARPLUGS The Loop Dream Earplugs are also around the same price at $49.95 and can be paired with the sleep mask for added sense mitigation.
Not only can the earplugs be re-used and cleaned, but they are lightweight and still block out around 27 decibels of noise to help those who are sensitive to sound or sleep with snoring partners.
Silicone and foam ear tips also make for a comfortable, virtually unnoticeable fit.
The Loop Dream Earplugs also comes with four sets of ear tips for customization and a bedside carry case.
Read More on The US Sun
LIAM DEATH PROBE Three charged in connection with Liam Payne's death after cops storm hotel
GR-APE ESCAPE Monkeys' Planet of Apes-style escape marks THIRD jailbreak from same facility Customers can get them in Lilac, Black, or Peach coloring.
The earplugs have earned a 4.3 out of five-star rating with over 146 reviews so far.

author: @daily_trust
title: Climate change: NNPC Ltd/Total Energies achieves zero gas flare - Daily Trust
text:
The Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation Limited (NNPCL)/TotalEnergies Joint Venture has said that it has achieved a zero routine gas flare in all its assets.
The Chief Corporate Communications Officer of NNPCL, Olufemi O. Soneye, said on Thursday in a statement that this was in pursuit of meeting the targets of 20% (unconditional) and 47% (conditional) greenhouse gas emission reduction as contained in the Nationally Determined Contribution under the Paris Accord signed by the President Bola Ahmed Tinubu administration.
This feat was announced on Thursday during an inspection tour of OML 100 in South-eastern Niger Delta, off Port Harcourt, by a joint NNPC Ltd and TotalEnergies Team to ascertain the success of the OML Flare Reduction Project launched in December 2023.
The NNPC Ltd/TotalEnergies Joint Venture, which is the concession holder of four leases, had hitherto achieved zero routine flaring across OML 99 (2006), OML 102 (2014), and OML 58 (2016), leaving OML 100 as the only lease with routine flaring going on.
Infrastructure: Kaduna trains project managers, others Katsina fixes February 2025 for council polls “The significance of this achievement is that the last routine flare volume of about 12MMscf/d (twelve million standard cubic feet per day) of gas has now been eliminated giving rise to a greenhouse gas emissions reduction of about 341KtCO₂e/yr.
“Work is ongoing across all other assets within NNPC Ltd’s Upstream Directorate to ensure that all assets achieve zero routine flaring by 2030 or earlier,” Soneye said.

author: Harry Stedman
title: UK bracing for heavy snow and icy rain after minus 5C temperatures overnight | The Independent
text: Large parts of the country will be hit with heavy snow and freezing rain over the weekend, forecasters have warned, after temperatures fell as low as minus 5C overnight.Stranded vehicles on the roads and delayed or cancelled rail and air travel will all be possible as the UK grapples with a week-long spell of wintry conditions, the Met Office said.Initial data indicated that Rostherne in Cheshire and Yeovilton in Somerset dropped to minus 5C overnight, just shy of previous estimates which suggested the mercury could dip as low as minus 8C.In Scotland, Eskdalemuir in Dumfries and Galloway felt the same chilly temperatures, hitting minus 5C at 11pm on Thursday.The coldest temperature recorded in January last year was minus 14C, in Dalwhinnie in the Scottish Highlands.A yellow warning for snow and ice is in place from 12pm on Saturday until 9am on Monday and covers most of England and Wales, while a separate warning for heavy snow from midnight on Sunday until 12pm on Monday has been issued for most of mainland Scotland.North-west England, Scotland, North Wales and Northern Ireland were also given a fresh yellow warning for icy surfaces, in place from 4pm on Friday to 10am on Saturday.Travel delays are possible along with a “small chance” of power cuts and injuries from slips and falls on icy surfaces, forecasters said.National Rail Enquiries said the line between Inverness and Dingwall in northern Scotland would be closed until at least 11am on Saturday because of “multiple landslips and areas flooded”, meaning no ScotRail services between Inverness and Wick/Thurso and between Inverness and Kyle of Lochalsh.Previous warnings for snow and ice covering much of Scotland, western areas of Wales, north-west England and Northern Ireland ended on Friday morning.UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) cold weather health alerts for all of England remain in place ahead of a week of low temperatures.Amber alerts were issued on Thursday and will run until January 8, meaning a rise in deaths is likely, the agency said.Dr Agostinho Sousa, head of extreme events and health protection at UKHSA, said: “The forecasted temperatures can have a serious impact on the health of some people, including those aged 65 and over and those with pre-existing health conditions, and it is therefore vital to check in on friends, family and neighbours that are most vulnerable.“These people could be more at risk of heart attacks, stroke and chest infections as a result of cold temperatures.”Councils across London and southern England have activated emergency measures including additional accommodation to help rough sleepers stay safe during the cold snap.James Lally, services director of homelessness charity St Mungo’s, said: “Access to a safe and warm place to live is vital for those experiencing homelessness all year round – and during freezing cold weather, emergency accommodation saves lives.“St Mungo’s frontline teams are prepared to respond to this critical situation, and continue to work tirelessly around the clock to make sure that as many people as possible can be brought out of the cold and into safety.”Dan Stroud, meteorologist at the Met Office, said conditions should become warmer by the end of the weekend before cold weather strikes again early next week.He said: “The second half of the weekend should be in the high singles or low doubles (for temperature figures).“But temperatures will dive again next week, particularly on Monday and Tuesday.“They should start to improve towards the latter end of the week. But there’s a lot of water to go under the bridge until then.”

author: @24tvua
title: Парень ушел в море в городке, а нашли его на необитаемом острове - Travel
text:
Поиски продолжались 17 часов. Парня чудом нашли живым и невредимым, рассказывает 24 Канал, ссылаясь на The Sun.
Обратите внимание Опасные маршруты: какие горы лучше обойти стороной
Как исчез парень?
Инцидент произошел в Австралии. 19-летний юноша взял свою доску для серфинга и пошел на пляж в городке Вули. Родители связались с полицией, когда поняли что их сын долго не возвращается домой.
Также родные обратились за помощью к соцсетям. Отец пропавшего парня написал: "Насколько мы знаем, Дарси взял с собой кремовую доску для серфинга и отправился примерно в 16:00. Мы считаем, что на нем был темный плащ. Конечно, мы боимся худшего. Сейчас мы хотим только одного – чтобы нашего любимого мальчика нашли целым и невредимым".
Впоследствии велосипед, одежду и обувь пропавшего нашли у подъезда к пляжу. Родители начали еще больше волноваться, и тогда же друг семьи создал группу в фейсбуке, чтобы придать делу огласку.
Что помогло его найти?
Позже местные власти написали, что юношу нашли на острове Норт-Солитари. Это примерно 14 километров от пляжа в Вуле.
Представитель местного медицинского округа сообщил, что парень в стабильном состоянии, а его отец назвал случай как "один на миллион".
Где расположен остров Норт-Солитари: карта
"Он прошел долгий путь, но он жив, в безопасности и получает необходимую помощь. Мы абсолютно поражены силой этого молодого человека и мощью этой невероятной общины", – написал впоследствии друг семьи.

author: O Globo com agências internacionais
title: Essa ilha paradisíaca na Austrália recebe apenas 400 turistas por vez; entenda o porquê
text: Um oceano com águas cristalinas, natureza abundante e viva, e cerca de 380 habitantes. Pode parecer uma descrição do paraíso, mas é da Ilha de Lord Howe, localizada no estado de Nova Gales do Sul, na Austrália. A ilha é considerada patrimônio mundial da humanidade pela UNESCO desde 1982 e carrega consigo um fato curioso: apenas 400 turistas são permitidos a visitá-la por vez. Para isso, todos os estabelecimentos para acomodação da ilha fixam o número de leitos disponíveis para os visitantes. Estes cuidados são tomados para preservar a fauna e a flora do local, que vinha sendo degradada desde o início da colonização europeia, especialmente da Inglaterra. Essa e outras medidas possibilitaram que aproximadamente 75% da vegetação natural original da ilha permanecesse intacta, de acordo com o site oficial de Lord Howe. Segundo o documento de comemoração dos 25 anos do estabelecimento da ilha como patrimônio mundial da humanidade, Lord Howe tem 241 espécies de plantas nativas, das quais 113, ou 47%, não são encontradas em nenhum outro lugar do mundo. A fauna do local é dominada em boa parte por pássaros, incluindo o Woodhen da Ilha Lord Howe, que tem sido o centro de um programa de criação em cativeiro do animal. Além do Woodhen, foram observadas 207 espécies diferentes de pássaros em Lord Howe e outras 15 espécies que são visitantes regulares da ilha. Mais de 1.600 espécies de insetos terrestres foram registradas no local, sendo que aproximadamente 60% delas não são encontradas em nenhum outro lugar. A exclusividade da visita acaba por tornar os preços na ilha mais caros. No Capella Lodge — uma das acomodações de Lord Howe —, a menor diária, disponível apenas para setembro, está em 1900 dólares australianos (cerca de R$ 7100 na cotação atual). Procedimentos rigorosos A ilha adota medidas de biossegurança a fim de se proteger contra espécies de animais e plantas invasoras. As importações e visitantes são meticulosamente inspecionados, incluindo cães farejadores. No início das trilhas — espalhadas por toda Lord Howe —, é possível observar postos para que os turistas e guias limpem os sapatos, a fim de evitar a propagação de fungos. Iniciativas de preservação As primeiras espécies invasoras da ilha chegaram junto com os primeiros colonizadores. Eles trouxeram, principalmente, animais já domesticados, como porcos, cabras, gatos, cavalos e cães. Na década de 1970, pesquisas ambientais já identificavam os danos causados às espécies de flora e fauna da ilha pelos mamíferos introduzidos. O estopim para que iniciativas mais firmes de recuperação e preservação da natureza da ilha foi a possível extinção do pássaro Woodhen, natural de Lord Howe. Na metade final do século XX, esta ave — que antes se espalhava por toda ilha — se limitava a apenas 20 indivíduos. Assim, em 1980, moradores da ilha passaram a montar uma verdadeira força-tarefa para conservar o Woodhen. Quase 200 porcos selvagens foram abatidos nas montanhas, guardas florestais prenderam cerca de oitenta gatos selvagens e os gatos domésticos foram banidos. Como parte do resgate da espécie, um programa de reprodução em cativeiro criou 93 filhotes de Woodhen. Em 1999, uma equipe de caçadores neozelandeses foi contratada para remover cabras selvagens que se espalharam pela ilha após serem trazidas por colonizadores. Durante um período de três meses, a equipe, juntamente com os habitantes locais, removeu 384 cabras. Conheça os refúgios dos famosos em meio à natureza Mais recente Próxima Policiais viram atirador de Trump em cima de telhado próximo a palco 20 minutos antes de atentado

author: @kbtxnews
title: A&M softball opens Judi Garman Classic blanking Michigan
text: A&M softball opens Judi Garman Classic with pair of wins FULLERTON, Calif. – Texas A&M starter Emiley Kennedy struck out 12 batters in a three-hit shutout win over Michigan, 6-0, Thursday at Anderson Family Field. Kennedy (8-0) dominated the circle to remain undefeated on the season, while registering a seventh complete game and fifth shutout of the year. The hard lefty thrower punched out double-digit batters for the third time this season and second consecutive outing. Michigan (10-6) sent 25 batters to plate, while four reached safely and only one threatened in scoring position. Texas A&M (16-1) scored one run in the opening frame and later doubled the lead after a solo home run courtesy of Jazmine Hill in the third. The Aggies have homered in 13 games this season, including a round tripper in four consecutive games. Ol’ Sarge’s charges opened it up in the fifth inning plating four runs on three hits, including a two-run double by Rylen Wiggins to make it 6-0. The No. 18 Texas A&M softball team run-ruled Long Beach State, 16-7, in six innings, Thursday night at the Anderson Family Field. Texas A&M (17-1) blasted four home runs and three doubles on 14 hits. Julia Cottrill led the way with a pair of round trippers and five RBI, while Trinity Cannon added a home run and four RBI and Rylen Wiggins hit a solo dinger. Kramer Eschete added to the offensive attack recording a double and three RBI. The Maroon & White put five runs on the board in the opening frame and third inning, while adding four more in the fourth and a two more in the sixth for the walk-off run-rule. Long Beach State (2-14) jumped out to an early 3-0 lead in the first inning after an Aggie error and fielder’s choice. The Aggies led 10-3 after three innings, before Beach narrowed the lead scoring four runs on four walks and two hits to come within three. Texas A&M ended all hope matching the scoreboard in the bottom half to put Beach back at seven-run deficit before ultimately ending it in the sixth. The home run derby marked the ninth time for the Maroon & White to hit multiple home runs in a game and the fifth consecutive game with at least one round tripper. Texas A&M plays two games on Friday beginning with Weber State at 5 p.m. and host Cal State Fullerton at 9:30 p.m., which can be streamed on ESPN+. Copyright 2024 KBTX. All rights reserved.
